body: I agree that we should split things into smaller, more manageable pieces and problems to address. I filled [REEF-70](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-70) as a new umbrella JIRA for these issues.
The changes have been checked in and rebased.

 )

On Thu, Dec 11, 2014 at 10:42 AM, asfbot notifications@github.com wrote:

> Reef-pull-request-windows #11
> https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/11/ UNSTABLE

> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-reef/pull/33#issuecomment-66556816.

## 

Byung-Gon Chun
@bgchun It depends. Sometimes two tests failed in windows ( https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/8/testReport/ )
Any more review comments for this PR with the latest update?

I don't think we should merge this at this point. There are two issues we currently know of which we should address first (probably in other PRs):
- Make DriverIdentifier optional [REEF-72](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-72)
- Extend the runtime API to expose runtime-specific Driver configurations. [REEF-71](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-71)

The latter is especially interesting, as I don't think the code in the PR can work without it. If it does, then  by happy accident :-)

The code has been reviewed and it generates the same config files as we run Launch with submit = false flag. However, as we clarified from clients recently, ASA team actually grabs the driver config from running Launch in Yarn env. Which contains more runtime configuration setting. SO more work need to be done in order to get complete driver.config although infrastructure work in this PR can still be leveraged in the future.
@markusweimer I've addressed your comments.
